section.title: Comparatives
section.sectiontitle: Use comparatives to talk about the differences between two things. With short adjectives add -er + than.
section.text3: He's intelligent. His friend isn't intelligent.
section.text3a: He's more intelligent than his friend.
section.text4: She's very beautiful. Her sister is beautiful.
section.text4a: She's more beautiful than her sister.

section.title: Comparatives
section.sectiontitle: Some adjectives are irregular: bad - worse, good - better, far - further.
section.text1: The book is good. The film isn't good.
section.text1a: The book is better than the film.
section.text2: The noise is bad. The smell isn't bad.
section.text2a: The noise is worse than the smell.
section.sectiontitle2: Use as + adjective + as to say two things are the same. Use not as + adjective + as to say two things are not the same.
section.text3: He's quiet. His sister is quiet.
section.text3a: He's as quiet as his sister.
section.text4: I'm strong. My father is very strong.
section.text4a: I'm not as strong as my father.
